title: Thresh Nerf Season 6
body:
Well in the preseason there was a load of changes and i think this nerf to thresh may be unintentional let me explain thresh does not gain any armor per level due to soul collection mechanic however each soul gained is classified as bonus armour and not natural armour. Therefore due to the changes in regards to Last Whisper thresh gets gimped pretty hard compared to any other champion and it really makes me wonder if they thought about him when they did these changes.

Tldr: All of thresh's armour gets reduced by last whisper everyone elses is just bonus armour.  {{champion:412}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

replies.body: Meh Thresh is OP anyway, no harm done.

Are you sure that wasnt my in-game doppelganger FioraTheExplora?

Sorry I can't say your name rings a bell.
I also have a friend called FedoraTheExplorer
What about that thresh doesn't get the melee execute when using targons, but also can't use runaanes? He can use ravenous, but isn't a melee champion?
He can't use Hydra (well he can, but the passive/active don't work). So, he's not melee OR ranged??

He can use Runaan's but his on hit effect doesn't proc flay bonus damage on the peripheral targets, just like Vayne can't proc silver bolts on runaan's hurricanes peripheral targets and Targon's wasn't working properly as part of a bug but they fixed it.
Wait, are you saying he can buy Runaan's after patch 5.22 but the flay damage is gone? Because before 5.22 he could both buy it and proc the flay damage on the bolts.

Oh, I didn't confirm but played it a while ago and pretty sure the flay dmg didn't proc but might not have been paying much attention to peripheral targets.

Flay bonus isn't up that often on ADC thresh in aram lol so I could be wrong, but 100% sure he can use runaans anyway which was the main point :p

It doesn't proc the %AD damage of Flay, but it still procs the base on-hit damage equal to the number of souls you've collected. So yeah, it doesn't synergize with full AD Thresh, but it did synergize with on-hit Thresh (BotRK, Wit's End, Nashor's Tooth). It was a fun item to build and in some situations it was actually good (like if your team didn't have enough pushing power).

Is it just me or does his hook range feel shorter than it used to be? Just played Thresh in an ARAM and I felt like I missed 30 hooks that I would have hit normally (and not because the enemies side-stepped or anything, the hooks just didn't reach). And I've played Thresh a LOT this season so I'm not just saying this because I played like trash one game (I didn't, we still won the game but so many hooks fell short and I feel like a week ago they definitely would have hit)
